satellites.name: Hubble Space Telescope
satellites.description: The Hubble Space Telescope has provided breathtaking images and invaluable data since its launch in 1990, revolutionizing our understanding of the universe.

satellites.name: International Space Station (ISS)
satellites.description: The ISS is a multinational collaborative project involving multiple space agencies, serving as a microgravity laboratory and observatory for scientific research.

satellites.name: James Webb Space Telescope
satellites.description: The James Webb Space Telescope is NASA's next-generation space observatory, set to launch in 2022, with the mission to explore the cosmos and unlock the mysteries of the universe.

satellites.name: Europa Clipper
satellites.description: The Europa Clipper mission aims to study Jupiter's moon Europa, with the goal of assessing its potential habitability by characterizing its ice shell, subsurface ocean, and geology.

satellites.name: Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter
satellites.description: The Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter is a multipurpose spacecraft designed to study Mars' atmosphere, surface, and subsurface, aiding in the search for past and present water and life.

satellites.name: Parker Solar Probe
satellites.description: The Parker Solar Probe is on a mission to study the Sun's outer atmosphere, or corona, and provide unprecedented insights into its behavior, helping scientists better understand solar activity.

satellites.name: Terra Satellite
satellites.description: The Terra satellite is part of NASA's Earth Observing System, studying the Earth's atmosphere, land, oceans, and biosphere to better understand climate change and its impacts.

satellites.name: Voyager 1
satellites.description: Voyager 1 is the farthest human-made object from Earth, launched in 1977 to explore the outer planets. It continues to send data from interstellar space, providing insights into our cosmic neighborhood.
